Reviews.Title: “Somewhere between dishonesty & a scam”
Reviews.Author: Steve_mad
Reviews.Content: We had a similar experience to some of the others commenting on this hotel. On arriving at the hotel we had booked, they informed us they had had a burst pipe and were sending us to another hotel (this one). This set off all sorts of alarm bells as I had heard of this scam with elsewhere. Sure enough, using the free internet in the lobby we spotted several other reviewers describing the same experience at this or other sister hotels. If they habitually over book and need to move people around then they should just say this, it would have made little difference. Instead though they blame something else and shuttle you off. The hotel was fine and the staff helpful but I will not be staying at this or any of their other hotels. There are too many competitors to need to take the risk.

Reviews.Title: “great value very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: drewexpert
Reviews.Content: We were transferred to this hotel from a sister hotel nearby due to building works - taxi called, comp tea while we waited. only round the corner. Very happy. Hotel was friendly and clean. Our room was near the back ( I think, not sure after walking down lots of corridors!) and plenty big enough and modern. Bathroom modern and clean, only slight negative was the shower didnt seem hot enough. We were given complimentary breakfast as we'd been moved and this was very good. Buffet style, loads of choice fruit, croissants etc, full english, yogurt etc. Wasnt sure if we were allowed it for a second morning but a quick phone call to reception and there was no problem. All in all a very pleasant hotel which I could safely recommend and at a very good price for central london. Easy walk to Hyde park or Paddington.

Reviews.Title: “Tiniest room ever”
Reviews.Author: Ananda99
Reviews.Content: I booked this room because of the location. Was a bit disappointed, but all in all I had a good stay. The free wifi only worked every now and then and my room was only slightly bigger than my suitcase. There was no floor space whatsoever, and there is no way I could have had another adult in this room, allthough it was supposed to be a double. The bed was 1 1/2, not a double and 2 suitcases iwould have been out of the question. The staff were friendly and helpful, though! And it was great that I could adjust the room temperature myself!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable rooms, but lethal hidden drops along corridors!”
Reviews.Author: leopard_woman
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we have stayed in this hotel establishment. Both times we had excellent rooms, huge space! Mind you first time we had a "club room" with kitchenette and sofa area, and second just a "deluxe double". Both were massively spacious and extremely comfortable beds, kept beautifully clean and some great views out over Paddington, both sides of hotel. (Providing on high floors).... Although, the only issues we have come across here, were finding out they did not read the "special requirements" asked when we booked the room, as told them I had had major back and neck surgery on spinal discs, so needed extra pillows. Had to retell and ask when handed key. Felt it was unprofessional and lack of personal care. Out the lift on 6th floor had to go through door straight on our left, not that unusual in terraced hotels. Suddenly, I was sprawled over the corridor as unexpectedly stepped into "mid air" as 2 very steep/ deep, but small width stairs! I jarred the metal brackets in my back, which were very painful for the rest of my 2 nights. Unfortunately, it meant could not do as much as planned on my trip either, which was very upsetting. After going out of room later, did see a tiny warning sign on the door. It definitely is not big enough for the lethal drop waiting behind the door! If the staff had bothered to read the requirement notes they could have warned us about the drop beforehand, or given us a room without such riskability. Thought I was going to be spending my 2 nights in the hospital down the road!

Reviews.Title: “reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Natalie M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while we were in london watching a show. we were on the 6th floor and didnt really have a view. the room was a bit small but was very clean. the bathroom was nice and the shower was very good. we didnt eat at the hotel as they were trying to charge us Â£15 each just for breakfast but there is lots of places around to get food. probably wouldnt stay here again but it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “The Hobbit London Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pastyp
Reviews.Content: I had to stay here last night for one night on short notice. Everything else in London seems to have been booked out. If you are 4' 6" tall and do not suffer from claustraphobia then this hotel would be fine. I am 6 foot tall and while I don't suffer from claustrophobia, small tight spaces make a little uncomfortable. The bedroom I had was on the ground floor facing the main road. It was very noisey with only single glazing. To give an idea of the size of the room - the bedroom had one standard size double bed. On either side of the bed there was barely 1 foot of clearance until you hit the wall. You could not comfortably walk around the bed so getting into bed by crawling from the end of it was the only way. Not so bad though if the rest of the room was okay. Well there was 2 feet of clearance between the end of the bed and the wardrobe. And that my friends was the extent of the room, save the bathroom - which was in all honesty not too bad in terms of size and condition. I entered the room with one average sized wheeled suitcase and a laptop bag. I put them down behind me at the door entrance and at that stage i could not move forward because of the bed and couldn't move backwards because my small amount of baggage was enough to block of the entrance! All in all VERY small. I tend to like to hang up my suit and shirts for the next business day in order that they are not wrinkled. When I attempted to do this I found that the wardrobe was not wide enough to accomodate the width of its own hangers! They hung at an angle, which meant that hanging anything more than two items in the wardrobe resulted in the door being wedged open. This had the affect of bunching up the clothes hanging in the wardrobe and actually encrouching into the already sparse space between the end of the bed and the wardrobe. To be fair the room was not in bad condition but it is extremely small. I have stayed in other small city hotels before, but this is extremely snug, the smallest i have ever seen. For more than one person travelling with more than one suitcase it would be impossible. The only other comments I would have is that the whole hotel is 'snug'. The corridors are narrow. Downstairs for breakfast one is inclinded to bend down going through door ways because of the low ceilings in the basement area. I would hate to see the rooms down there if they are as small as mine on the ground floor, coupled with the low ceilings it would be like sleeping in a coffin. So if you are hobit sized with hobbit sized luggage then go for it. If not I would suggest looking else where or at least preparing yourself for a 'snug' experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel; worth a visit!”
Reviews.Author: Livy1000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night as I was attending a friendâ€™s birthday dinner. The hotel was located in a great location which was really close to the train station making it easy to find and reach central London quickly and easily. Although I had only booked a basic double room I was actually given a huge superior room. It had TWO king size beds in there and an enormous bathroom. Fantastic considering I only paid Â£50! I was incredibly impressed with the modern dÃ©cor, the extremely comfortable beds and the lovely powerful shower which woke me up. Just what was needed after one too many drinks the night before! The room was lovely and quiet too and I had a great nights sleep. The staff throughout my stay were very friendly, helpful and polite without being intrusive and my luggage was taken up to the room for me which was a nice touch. I didnâ€™t have breakfast here but the restaurant, bar and lounge looked lovely. The entire hotel infact was very nice and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: Claire096
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks much grander on the outside than the price we paid which immediately reassures you. The rooms are small but are decorated well, are clean, has what you need and comfortable to stay in. The location was quite good - not far from tube stations or buses, which made it an ok base for the tourist attractions and more cost effective than staying in the heart of the West End. I've selected very good as much better than staying in similar hotels and chains of hotels - although if we had paid full price I'd have been less impressed. It wasn't perfect - the first annoying thing is that it has an entirely different name in gold lettering across the top where you would expect the name of the hotel, which is very disorientating when you're looking for it. We went by the address numbers after spending far too long wandering around and when up close found a small plaque with the name on that we were expecting - If it says Park Lane across the top you have found it! Secondly our key card needed re-setting every night when we returned, very annoying when you've gone up to the third floor, the door doesn't open and then you have to go all the way back down. This happened for the additional two nights we stayed after we checked in. In all it is a good place to stay, you will often need to change twice on a tube so expect some travelling and if like us you made the most of your day this is not cheap as we travelled at peak times (before 10am and after 4.30pm). Didn't have breakfast as not included in our booking and seemed a bit pricy to add, but the facilities in the room meant we could have a drink easily.

Reviews.Title: “One quiet Saturday night in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Challett49
Reviews.Content: A rare experience for me, I needed to stay in London on my own after a meeting so I could catch my train home easily in the morning. With this in mind, I research a convenient hotel close to Paddington Station. The Shaftesbury Premier Hyde Park is a perfect fit for that, being a few hundred yards round the corner in Westbourne Terrace, an easy walk. The only other consideration was the very reasonable discounted price I found on line. The review I'd seen were pretty mixed, but not scary, so I reckoned it would be alright, if not that brilliant. The reality was a delight - set back from the main road, the entrance is attractive and well-maintained. The reception area is bright and the staff charming and helpful at check-in. My room was a small single at the very back of the hotel. Immaculatly clean with what seemed a newly-fitted en-suite, the lack of space was not an issue for just one night, might have been different if I were staying for some time, but the thing which really pleased me was how totally quiet it was at the back of the hotel. I didn't eat in the hotel, as they didn't offer evening meals when I was there, but there are plenty of local eateries. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: vicmadgesally
Reviews.Content: My partner and I are seasoned travellers and we visit London several times a year from S Wales We look for a decent hotel that is not going to break the bank.We booked this hotel for 2 nights from Sunday 29th Jan. We were advised the room would be available from 14.00 and when we arrived half an hour early we were advised the room was not ready When we returned on time we were promptly upgraded to a club room. This was an excellent double, well furnished clean, spacious, and with an excellent bathroom All first class and the best value for money hotel we have stayed in and around the Hyde Park/Queensway area ( and we have tried a few over the years) We did not eat at the hotel so no comments. Handar and Patricia looked after us perfectly and we thank them and we will definely return

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Linda T
Reviews.Content: I was booked in to one of the other Shaftesbury Hotels, but on check-in was told they would need to move me to' Premier Hyde Park'. I was a little dubious about the change,but the transfer happened quickly and efficiently & I was offered breakfast (free) during my stay, for the inconvenience. The staff at the Premier Hyde Park were all very pleasant and helpfull. NICE TOUCHES: 1) Fresh flowers in room and on tables in Dining Room. 2) Complimentary magazines and newspapers in reception. 3) Underfloor heating in the bathroom. In all the Premier Hyde Park was very good, and alot better than expected. It is, 'small but prefectly formed'. Well done, to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “There are better places! But its not the worst :)”
Reviews.Author: Specialk-74
Reviews.Content: This would have been given a three star rating if our room was not tucked away in the basement beside a massive vent. The noise from this could have been a big deal if I didnt have earplugs with me. Thankfully I always travel with them. The aircon in our room when turned off gave a groan every so often too which again could have been an issue if earplugs were not available. When we went into the room, the room is very small, it could definitely have used a new table as the one we had was dreadful and took away from the room at first glance. We did ask to be moved and was told that the hotel was full but they did offer to move us the fourth floor on the second day but we had unpacked at that stage so we declined. We were staying there with friends. My friends also asked to be moved as they were also in the basment which had the noise of the vent combined with being right beside the kitchen so noise levels were quite high. Our other friend was located on the four floor in a lovely double room with underground heating in the bathroom. Its just luck of the draw which room you get. Having said that, the bed was extremely comfortable and the room was clean. If your out and about then somewhere to put your head down is all you need. The tube station is less then 10 minutes walk and we found the location very handy. I would give it a rating of three but as I said putting us in the basement of the hotel beside the vent knocked a star off for me. We paid 207 sterling for three nights which was good value. We were told this was half price. If we payed the full price of over 400 sterling I would have been pretty pissed off. The staff were nice I have to say. We didnt get breakfast so have no comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: tim c
Reviews.Content: i was scared after booking and reading the reviews on here but i can honestly say this hotel for the price is brilliant. not loads of room but enough to get changed and the beds are huge and very comfortable. if your going to london to spend all the time in your room then dont go to this hotel. if you simply want somewere quiet comfortable and clean to sleep and spend an hour or so getting changed then book this 100% staff very helpfull and pleasant

Reviews.Title: “do not recommend”
Reviews.Author: Paul v
Reviews.Content: Unfriendly and unhelpful reception staff... extremely tiny rooms - this is the second shaftesbury i've traveled to and their both a nightmare... No more shafesbury for me...

Reviews.Title: “a very clean and friendly, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ToniandKiki
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very sweet and we enjoed our trip so much. The Hotelstuff is very nice and friendly and the hotel is very clean and nice. We had Breakfast including and the little buffet was very okay and they fill it up all the time. The Subway Lancaster is so closed, you can walk in about 3 minutes to it, also to the beautyful Hydepark. Lancaster is about one stop away from the Oxford Street... We loved our staying in this Hotel and we will book it allso in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Alright for a quick business trip, not much more.”
Reviews.Author: liceas
Reviews.Content: I booked last minute looking for a place to stay in London during London Brand and Licensing in October and have only had time to catch up now. On arrival they said they had no booking from me - as far as I can establish this happens when you book via a third party like Ebookers. It's not usual for them not to receive the booking outright (sometime it's in a company name like ORBITZ but never not there). Not sure what the game is there but there were 2 other business people in the same position when I arrived so this seems to be an upsettingly frequent occurrence. Room was small for usual but adequate, was barely in it due to meetings anyway so was not overly concerned about the room as a result. Bathroom was cramped but again fully furnished so no real issues - except my view was of the same horrible back-yard that someone else posted. Complete with same mangy mattress et al. Would not recommend unless you really need a place near the station or such to get out to Heathrow or a one night business trip where all you will do is sleep there...assuming they remember you have a room!

Reviews.Title: “SCAM SCAM SCAM”
Reviews.Author: Fred P
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at these hotels. I recently had a confirmed booking (with credit card) only to find there were no rooms at all. They said it was because of maintenance, but I asked around and other hotels told me they over book and simply ship you out to another hotel - if they can find one. There were four other customers in the same boat as me and it was not pleasant. Apart from this scam, they lied to me and it seems other hotels know what is going on. My strong advice to all is DO NOT USE THE SHAFTESBURY BRAND OF HOTELS.

Reviews.Title: “Try somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: TorynAaron
Reviews.Content: It's hard to write a review on this place given that we didn't make it past the lobby. We booked here despite reading some of the reviews and wish we hadn't. On arrival, we were told that there was no record of our booking and that the hotel was overbooked. We were offered a cab to the alternative hotel they offered, but were also informed it would be quicker to walk. After lugging our bags through the streets, we made it to the Best Western Shaftesbury Paddington Court London. Additionally, we attempted to contact the hotel numerous times prior to arriving in London to discuss altering our booking, with no response. We have the feeling this "lost booking" story is used regularly to fill the hotel and shuffle excess guests to sister hotels. Do yourself a favour and find a good hotel near a tube station and catch the train to Paddington instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and rooms”
Reviews.Author: Lloyd C
Reviews.Content: Went there for 2 nights with my girlfriend. we were given a club room which was on the ground floor. Room was very clean, nice beds and furniture, flat screen tv, and even underfloor heating in the bathroom. Room was a little small but this did not bother us as we only stayed in the room to sleep. friendly staff and only 5mins walk to paddington station. Breafast was offered to us but was too expensive but there are several restaurants and cafe's minutes away from the hotel which have good bargains. Only problem we found was that the room wasn't very sound proof and we could hear our neighbour using the shower and speaking at the early hours of the morning. Overall good hotel and highly recommended .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location. A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Paully1974
Reviews.Content: Our stay for 2 nights could not be faulted. The room size was much bigger than anticipated after reading reviews on Tripadvisor. When we arrived there was a problem with our travel agent not paying for our accomodation with a non-maxed out credit card. The staff were extremely helpful and chased this up for us. We arrived from australia at aroun 9:30am and a room was already available for us. This was greatly appreciated. The staff were extremely helpful and knew the area well. They even gave us a few tips on how to save ourselves a few pounds to get to Euston Station for our train trip to Scotland. Overall and excellent experience. Would definitely stay again...no questions asked.

Reviews.Title: “Room rates are in the land of fantasy”
Reviews.Author: susan s
Reviews.Content: Room advertised at Â£350 deluxe single-for a broom cupboard Incredibly small -probably smallest room I have ever stayed in-made premier inn look like a palace very deceptive policy poor hotel in general

Reviews.Title: “Okay, I guess”
Reviews.Author: DublinCityCruiser
Reviews.Content: Based on some of the photos on this site, I actually received a decent room. That said, the bedroom was still very small so it was a good thing that I was the only person trying to navigate around the rather tiny space. The bathroom was compact and there was very little room between the bathtub and the toilet - positives were that the bathroom actually was en-suite and was spotlessly clean. Other benefits were the in-room kettle and tea/coffee, a heater that worked well and responded to setting changes, and close proximity to Paddington station. Getting to the room from the front desk required a very keen sense of direction and an adventurer spirit (and light luggage) as I had to climb several sets of stairs to find my room initially. The narrow hallways and multiple sets of stairs and fire doors make moving around with luggage very difficult. So, if you are small framed, like tight spaces, have little to no luggage and enjoy hiking around the corridors of hotels after dark looking for your room, this hotel is for you. If not, this is a very average hotel for London with good proximity to the station.

Reviews.Title: “Budget not premier”
Reviews.Author: Ian G
Reviews.Content: Smallest double ever! Couldn't walk round the bed had to climb over each other. TV did not work which they tried to hide by removing the remote control. Premier Inn or Travel Lodge next time, rather than this

Reviews.Title: “A tale of two Hotels”
Reviews.Author: jomcvitie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Shaftesbury Premier London Hyde Park with my partner after booking at the sister hotel The Shaftesbury Premier London Paddington. We were told the Paddington had no room even though we had booked there and were offered a room here instead. I can see how this would be annoying for many but as the hotel (I am told) is pretty much the same and is only across the road I really didn't mind. We were offered an early check in and a complimentary full english breakfast as compensation. This was fine by me as the breakfast charge was normally Â£15 per person. The room was spacious enough for one night, however if I was staying longer I think it would be a bit cramped. The bathroom was tiny and could be annoying for someone larger than myself. The room wasn't particularly clean as the surfaces had not been wiped and there was a stain on the duvet. However the facilities in the room were satisfactory. I'm not sure if I would stay again, possibly if I was in London for a short time, as it was good value and I have a feeling most hotels of the same price in the same location would be the same if not worse.

Reviews.Title: “Noisey faux quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Goodadvisorreview
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week. I started off in the basement with a tiny room facing a wall with slightly damp smelling aircon. The bathroom was tiny and you could only just fit into the area for the WC (I'm average size). The walls on either side of my room were so thin i could hear every word of my neighbour's phone conversation on one side, and on the other, my neighbours 'being intimate' . Luckily, my internet wasn't working (the socket was hanging out of the wall - no wireless available from hotel) so after a couple of days, I was upgraded to the third floor in an 'executive studio'. The upgraded room was more spacious and less damp, however, the door to my room was adjacent to the speaking lift and ALL night long you could hear it saying 'fist floor, second floor' etc. The doors also slam quite loudly as they close. Although the bathroom was clean on the surface, there was visible mould in my shower in the corners of the silicone grouting. This also led to quite a mouldy smell in the bathroom as a whole. The fittings are all made to seem solid and of quality, but this is superficial. Although the hotel's just been redone, it's already getting a bit worn and shabby. The rooms also had quite a dark feel to them. I have to say that the staff were all very friendly and helpful with all my enquiries and the location (5 mins to Paddinton) was great but as I like a quiet night's sleep and enough space to swing a cat, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “DELUXE ROOM - NEVER IN A MILLION YEARS!!”
Reviews.Author: pargafanDronfield
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms for a one night stay on fo Saturday 29 October. A large room to sleep four for my daugher and grandchildren and what was supposed to be a deluxe double for my husband and I. It is the smallest double room I have ever seen. The space around the bottom and side of the bed must have been approximately 9 inches. At the bottom of the bed you also had to lean over the bed otherwise you would have bumped into the large wall mounted television. I asked three times to check if there had been a mistake regarding the room and was told that this was definitely a deluxe room. The bathroom is also tiny - getting dried is almost impossible as you keep banging into the wall and shower cubicle - we ended up having to leave the door open into the room. I am aware hotel rooms can be on the small side but this one took that rule to a new level. Having had a hard day shopping and sight-seeing we thought a relaxing drink in the bar might be nice. The bar turned out to be in the breakfast room. The only place to sit was at a dining table. There was a very poor selection of drinks (all warm) and after just one drink we were asked if we required more at the bar was about to close - this was approx 10.15 p.m. I accept that we did pay a discounted price for the rooms. having booked through an agency but the cost of the two rooms (without breakfast) came to Â£358.00 for the one night. Also payment was taken upon check-in. A very mediocre breakfast served by totally miserable staff could be purchased for Â£12.00 per head. I would be most interested to know what counts as de-luxe , comparing it to our duaghters room all I can guess is that it means "smallest room in hotel". Never again!!!

Reviews.Title: “low cost hotel”
Reviews.Author: 852kane
Reviews.Content: stayed at the above for 2 nights, had a clubroom for 3 adults.. lots of room, great bathroom, flowers in room and serviced everyday..breakfast was very good as well, 5 min walk from paddington and staff are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “My trip to London”
Reviews.Author: Geoffrey H
Reviews.Content: The location was pleasant and ideal for me on this occasion. The single room looked to have been recently refurbished and was of adequate size although there was nowhere to put luggage. It was clean and very well equipped and the bathroom quite large although I gather not all are so spacious and may only have a shower; mine had a bath as well. At Â£99 the price was competitive with significantly less lugubrious hotels and in this city represents very good value for money. The staff were helpful and the full English breakfast was excellent and worth the Â£12 extra (reduced from Â£15 as a special price). Overall very good to excellent and I would rate it 4 1/2 stars if the scale allowed. Would reccomend without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the money!”
Reviews.Author: marin k
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel a few times before the refurbishment but it looks better now! The double room I booked was not very big, but good enough for my two nights stay! Breakfast was ok, buffet with big choice, a bit cold though!Reception Staff was helpful, especially Eva as she checked me in and made a few bookings for better London stay for me and my friend! There is also a luggage room to drop your bags after check out! I will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “A cosy and handy hotel”
Reviews.Author: ParshinV
Reviews.Content: Right at the heart of Paddington. 15 mintutes to heathraw airport if using train. 5 minutes walk to hyde park. The club rooms are in 2 leves. the bed and lavetory down stairs and small kitchen with a living room up. The lavetory is too small. If you have wide shoulder don't bother at all. Cleaning not impressive. Free high speed internet. free fruit to pick at reception. Two LCD TVs one in each level.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant place to stay in this location”
Reviews.Author: Ser579
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a twin room and had the continental breakfast. The rooms were fantastic. Little small but nothing compared to other hotels in the area. Definately recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Location is excellent, & everything else, too!”
Reviews.Author: LeighRobb
Reviews.Content: I just returned from spending a week at this hotel and was very happy with my experience. Only two blocks from Paddington Station in a quiet neighborhood with a pub just a block & a half away. The room was updated and clean, loved the shower, the TV and electric kettle were much appreciated. It was quiet and the staff were very helpful. American travelers should note that London hotel rooms are generally smaller, but really, how much space do you need??? My window looked out the back, but I didn't mind a bit as it was still a view of London! Thanks to the staff, I would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money with good reception”
Reviews.Author: cevizor
Reviews.Content: We got a very warm reception from the day go particularly from the Duty Manager of the first night. The triple room we lodged was very neat and nice, spacious and equipped with needed gadgets including microwave and TV. The location of the hotel is nice. It and was perfect for us and close an underground station. For the price of the rooms, I thought we had good value for money. I definitely can recommend this hotel to anyone and can return next time.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view...of rubbish for Â£150”
Reviews.Author: szinbad
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, the wonderful hotel near Hyde Park where I usually stay was fully booked, so I stayed in Shaftesbury Premier London Hyde Park. I wasn't only I have the view of rubbish from my window but everything else is rubbish in this hotel apart from the location. They charge you the whole amount on check in but they are very reluctant to provid a VAT receit, not to mention itemized billing. Don't be fooled broadband internet means no wifi but a ropey cable coming from the wall, so no chance to connect your iPad. And for Â£150 staying in the basement staring at dirty matrasses and broken chairs? No, thank you. Take the advice of a seasoned traveller and don't even think about ever staying in this please if you want pleasent memories from a holiday or just good night sleep on a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location Deluxe double room”
Reviews.Author: Emmy33
Reviews.Content: Visted London with daughter and only booked few weeks before travel. very pleased with room as some of the reviews had scared me off. Room very clean, bathroom clean and adequate for the two of us. Ideal location for train and tube. Downside to hotel was that Bar area was poor.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking lack of service and attentiveness to guests.”
Reviews.Author: Chippyqueen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last night and will never do it again. Purchased through Lasterooms as it was one of the only 'resonably' priced hotels in London left at such a late stage, I used reasonable loosely as it was in excess of Â£200 which in this case is daylight robbery. I arrived to find the lights not working in my room and it took all of 40minutes to get the hotel to do soemthing about it - stood in the lobby argueing the toss with the Manager who seemed reticent to help. I started to feel like an inconvenience to them. The Shaftsbury Suites Marble Arch is one of my favourite properties in London so I cant understand why this hotel, another in their portfolio is so poor.

Reviews.Title: “For the price, it was more than acceptable! Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Rollinball
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and newly furnished, we got upgraded to a family room with 2 double beds. The room was large, very clean, excellent tv, iron and an ironing board, coffee and tea making facilities including biscuits eveything you require for a weekend away, two down sides was the size of the bathroom and because it was an exceptionally winding evening our window didn't close probably so there was lots of noise from the window clattering.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: hookybear
Reviews.Content: I took my mum to London for a few days, and we chose this hotel as being fairly central, handy for the West End, where we had a couple of shows booked, and for Buckingham Palace, as we had booked the tour. The hotel was clean, although rather impersonal, and did exactly what it said it would; a decent room, bathroom, and a satisfactory breakfast. Beware - The Shaftesbury Premier Paddington is a few doors down across the road - the two look very similar, resulting in a bit of confusion! The room: fairly small - neither I nor my mum are very tall; had we been, we may have struggled for space and legroom. After opening the door, there were four steps down into the room, halfway up which was the bathroom door, which opened outwards. So be aware if you are someone with mobility difficulties, or if you are afraid of falling up or downstairs in the dark, you should check this out. Adequate tea and coffee making facilities, with biscuits and fresh fruit and a daily newspaper provided. The bathroom was tiny, with the smallest of ledges on which to put toiletries etc. The shower was somewhat "cosy" in terms of elbow-room. However, again it was clean and there were plenty of towels, with shampoo, conditioner and shower gel provided if you needed it. Our main gripe was with the temperature in the room and hotel in general. It was extremely warm - the air con unit in the room did not appear to work at all, and the window was sealed shut. This, coupled with the tiny bathroom, in which I don't think the fan was working, made for a very sticky and uncomfortable time after two people had showered. Breakfast: Usual hotel fare, with full English as part of buffet. This was ok, although not always piping hot. Disappointingly tea and coffee was from vacuum jugs and was "help yourself". Judging by the very little amount which the waiting staff appeared to do, I didn't think it would overtax them to serve drinks hot and fresh. All of that said, we spent very little time in the room,and the hotel was well placed for what we wanted to do. Reception staff went out of their way to help us - I had e-mailed to ask for a room upgrade as the trip was to celebrate my mum's birthday. They said they had nothing available the first night, but that they would move us the next day. In the event we did not take them up on this, as we were only there for 2 nights, and couldn't be bothered to move, but we appreciated the gesture. So if it's luxury and comfort you are looking for, you may wish to look elsewhere, but if you want somewhere handy and reasonably priced you will be ok.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Adam581
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over the August bank holiday and got a great deal on the room. It is conveniently located a 2minute walk from Paddington Station, however as the weather was nice we were able to walk to Oxford Street and into Leicester Square (although this is quite a walk). Also nicely located for Hyde Park. The hotel itself was clean and the staff helpful although all we did was checkin and out. The room was small but this is expected in London, clean and had all we needed. If I needed to stay in this area agian I would choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super Nice Hotel and a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CanadaReviewer
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I stayed at the Shaftesbury Premier Hyde Park Paddington for three days in July. We were all impressed with the room, and especially the quality of the beds and bedding. It was quiet and well located being only a block from Paddington Station. Our breakfast was included with the room. It was really exceptional, and well worth the money. We all looked forward to getting up in the morning just to rush down to the beautiful breakfast. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone touring London, and I would be happy to return for another stay. I would also like to mention that this was one of the few hotels that offered quad accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Subs123
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews on trip advisor I was a little concerned about booking this hotel but we stayed here recently and the staff were very friendly and we had a pleasant stay. We stayed on the 7th floor, had an "large" room (for London!) having paid much more on other occasions for far less square footage at other hotels! The bed was very comfortable and the ensuite was nice, and had an impressive shower. Our room, which was newly decorated, was very quiet but the lift only went to the 6th floor so we had to take the stairs to the 7th floor. Overall a nice place to stay, close to Paddington station.

Reviews.Title: “accommodation selected for business trip”
Reviews.Author: maturecoupleMalta
Reviews.Content: I was a bit hesitant when I booked this hotel given the less than favorable comments on the TripAdvisor site. But I have to say that my (two night) stay was a pleasant surprise. The refurbishment - which seems to have been the source for several negative reviews - was complete and while the rooms are yes London-sized, the bathroom (shower cubicle) was more than suitable for my needs (and frame) and the fittings were all new and of high quality. Except for the little accident! Opened up the mixer tap (all nice and new) and the tap shot out making a sizable hole in the nice and new stylish round basin! Phoned reception who were very understanding and efficient about this and someone was sent to check the situation in the space of a few minutes. For the second night I was given a change of room and although I opened the tap there very carefully I am glad to report that no further accidents occurred. Would go back anytime especially as the hotel is very central, a few metres away from Paddington Station (Heathrow Express) and in a fairly quiet avenue. Good breakfast and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusted”
Reviews.Author: ribs160379
Reviews.Content: Room description was Ver missleading - This was worse than a travelodge room, Damp and torn wall paper. Workmean in the early hours. Location description is missleading. Staff were unhelpfull when questioned over the state of the room, on line feedback was also ignored. Never Again !!

Reviews.Title: “I loved it”
Reviews.Author: LaughtonFamily
Reviews.Content: I had a club room, so maybe this was better than the other rooms reveiwed. I went to the India test at Lords and needed an affordable base. The Shaftsbury was clean, the staff polite. the room was well appointed. Not keen on booking bed and breakfast only to be told that breakfast was Â£14.00 extra, so had breakfast near Lords. The Hotel is in an excellent location; I would defintitley use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs!!!”
Reviews.Author: Doncastergeordie
Reviews.Content: During our stay the room was access broken into and two mobile phones were stolen. The Hotel staffs were indifferent and didnâ€™t even offer to call Police despite our room being door being opened again on a subsequent evening by someone who opened it and left open all night whilst we were out of the room. Three months later I am still chasing the hotels insurance company for compensation and the hotel has washed their hands of the situation donâ€™t reply to my emails. The air-conditioning didnâ€™t work, the key card system was locking guests out of rooms, the breakfast was rubbish, the showers didnâ€™t provide hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling treatment - avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: mygiddyaunt
Reviews.Content: I'll try to keep this short. Needed a hotel in Paddington for a pitch meeting. I travelled down from up north, worked until 11pm at our London office, went to my pre-booked, nearby hotel for some sleep as I had to be back in the office by 8:30am. Got to hotel - the reception area looked really nice. They asked me to wait while they tried to find my details. The guy on reception was a bit dopey to be honest, so someone more senior took over. After a while they said that I hadn't been allocated a room yet. I asked how this could be possible seeing as it was 11pm and I had pre-booked. They clearly had over-booked and had given my room away. They said that they would get me a room in their sister hotel. When I asked where this was, he gestured 'down the road' - I asked if he meant the same named hotel across the road and down a bit? He nodded but said not to worry, he'd get me a cab and I would be in my room soon. 30 MINUTES later a cab turned up, which was just as well as I was near tears due to lack of sleep and the stress about the next morning's very important pitch. I got into the cab - the driver was very nice. I would like t point out that the people at the hotel did not apologise once or even seem remotely sorry for the inconvenience. So, the cab pulled out and went the wrong way. I asked where he was taking me and he said to Earls Court! I made him turn around and go back to the hotel just so I could have a rant at them, but there was no choice - it was too late for me to find somewhere else to stay and I was too tired and just wanted to go to bed. I did insist that they arranged a cab to get me back to the office in the morning - they suggested the hotel but I said why would I want to go back there and the very least they could do is get me to the office, for free, seeing as I would have to get up even earlier to get through the awful rush hour traffic in the morning (at least a 40 minute journey now rather than a 5 minute walk). So, off to Earl's Court we went (still no apology). The cab driver said that yes, the proprietor's were rude and this wasn't the first time he'd had to do this. So we pull up outside the hotel in Earl's Court, I get into reception, tell them my name and he does actually apologise but informs me that according to the system, I am in another of their hotels up the street, so off I trot. This hotel was quite a small, narrow affair, but ok. The staff were nice and assured me that my cab would be there for 7:30 and that I could have a free breakfast (wow - they'd normally charge Â£15, but it would probably only cost them Â£2). My room was on the top floor (the lift only went as far as the floor below). It was very small, but nicely furnished with a nice bathroom. However, it was very warm seeing as it was in the loft and the windows opened up onto railway lines so I was serenaded to sleep by the loud shriek of trains braking. That's not it... in the morning, I got down to reception at 7:20am the next morning. They offered me breakfast but I said I was ok thanks. They were very nice though. When I asked if my cab was coming, I think I jogged their memory - they'd clearly forgotten to order it and there was much whispering down the phone. They kept insisting I had some breakfast - I think they were trying to get me out of the way while they sorted my cab - in the end I said yes, thinking I would grab a croissant to go, but then the porter starts leading me out of the front door - turns out breakfast was in the hotel down the road that sent me to them the night before! That was the last straw - I declined breakfast as I was too angry to eat. My cab eventually turned up at 7:45 - late. So, avoid this hotel at all costs. I can't vouch for the hotel itself as I never got to stay there, but anyone can create a nice hotel. What 'makes' a hotel is the experience and the way you are treated and how they make you feel, which is why this hotel (well, the Group) gets a 'terrible' rating.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel. Poor service”
Reviews.Author: FredoNYC
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in the hotel for 7 days in July 2011 and the service has been really poor..The staff is unfriendly and the single room is extremely small, internet was not available in the rooms..I would advise to avoid this hotel if you want to stay in London as the ratio service/price is not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: deea22
Reviews.Content: Hello! I was in London with bussines and I loved to stay in a very good area in this hotel in the central area.......the rooms are a little small but they were very clean......I also had free internet in my room and wi-fi in the reception and lobby area.....the staff was very polite and they help me with any problem I had especialy miss Arabela from the reception.....she was very nice and helpfull so I realy enjoyed my stay here.....I'm planing to be back very soon......

Reviews.Title: “3 star maybe.....4 star NEVER!”
Reviews.Author: chrissie1969
Reviews.Content: Well I never usually complain about hotels really, but felt compelled to in this case. Stayed here for one evening only. Sadly I found things a little sub-standard for a 4 star establishment. I checked in and paid my Â£129 for a single and was asked for a further deposit of Â£10?! I was then told that my room was turn left, right then up two flights of stairs (I was not offered any help to the room with my heavy bag), then I was greeted by numerous 'Wet Paint' signs all the way up the very narrow staircase, and a very strong smell of gloss paint. Trying to manouvre a large bag and myself up this staircase (and I am only a petite size 10!) without getting any gloss on yourself was like an assault course. The rooms were incredibly small (I would actually use the word pokey). They were in the middle of major refurbishments (which I was not informed of), the staff seemed fraught and immediately defensive of any mild criticism. Ongoing refurbishments had evidently left the hotel with no air conditioning (and it was a particularly hot few days) and although electric fans were provided, space in the room was so lacking that the fan kept getting knocked over. There was also no mini bar or fridge in the room, just an empty cupboard where one had clearly been, so keeping cold drinks cool was a problem. Broadband internet access was also advertised however it was slow and intermittant, again my complaint was simply greeted with a defensive shrug of the shoulders. In my opinion (and I am aware that this is London pricing) this hotel is completely overpriced and of poor quality, this is not a 4 star hotel and although it was clean and modern it is more applicable to a 3 star grading. I stayed in a 4 star around the corner, only last year and not only was it much better quality and worthy of its 4 star rating and it was also half the price of this one! I wouldn't say not to go to this hotel, but as long as you get a good discount and expect 3 star value you will be happy.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service & cold water!”
Reviews.Author: A_Matt_83
Reviews.Content: The first issue: When we arrived myself and my colleague were expecting a package necessary for our business to be waiting for us behind reception. I was not on the register even though I had documentation from lastminute.com saying the room was booked under my name. This meant the parcel that had been delivered was turned away. This cause me and my company no end of hassle and even after I had stayed there one night I was still not on the register and turned the second attempt at delivery away! Secondly: We were there on a very hot day and the air conditioning in my room wasn't working even though the manager told me on several occasions that I was wrong and that "it is a hot day Miss, the air conditioning is definitely working!" My air con controls said it was on full blast and at 17 degrees and you couldn't even feel anything coming out the vents. It was not working. I got a desk fan in the end which was adequate. Thirdly: The water was cold on both mornings which meant a cold shower before each hectic day of work. The hotel staff didn't mention anything about it and when I complained at checkout the receptionist said "oh yes, the boiler isn't working" she then went on to tell me the long story of how it was broken but didn't apologise until I questioned the level of customer service I had received throughout my stay. She still acted as if the cold water was my problem. All together a very uncomfortable, cramped and frustrating stay. I would not recommend this to anyone especially for business where you stay has to be comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Cold showers and always-surprised staff”
Reviews.Author: holyschmoly
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there with my colleague for three nights. The experience was poor. The rooms were small and, being located in the basement, extremely hot. The aircon in my colleague's room didn't work, and she was offered... a fan! It didn't occurred to anyone to put her in a different room. The best bit was a receptionist reaction: "Oh I assure you that the aircon works. It's just that it's a warm day!" :) I've been lucky - my room was big enough to put the ironing board in (which wasn't the case at the Shaftesbury Bayswater I have been in before). My colleague's room, on the contrary, was approximately of a fridge-like size. Most refreshing, when you are coming back after a whole day of work to rest for a while. Having said that, the room I have been put in was next to the cleaner's room so the only way for me to work at my desk was with my headphones on. Otherwise, I could heard every bit of the conversation going on next door. For the last two mornings of our stay we have had cold showers. The always-surprised staff explained that there are some 'boiler issues'. There was a 'misfired' fire drill on the last night. It's painful to wake up at three o'clock, scared of the noise. Not bad for a 4 star hotel, huh? Seems like not a single staff person we've met had given any attention to our queries. A shame. Let's put it this way: next time I will go to Holiday Inn or Ibis. Yes, they are simpler, cheaper, etc. - but at least no one says they're 4 star and you know what to expect. If this is a 4 star hotel, then I am Albert Einstein. Oh! And I think they reset the key cards every 24 hours, as mine had to be programmed again on every day of my stay... :)

Reviews.Title: “Never a 4 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: traceymclardy
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel during a weekend trip to London as I was going to Hard Rock Calling in Hyde Park. Both myself and my partner were extremely looking forward to our stay in the 'delux doube suite' which I booked for Â£150 per night (not including breakfast may I add). The hotel initially appears to have some potential- it seems clean enough and looks fairly standard from the outside. The location is also fairly central- only a short walk away from Paddington station however upon further inspection the walls and ceiling were yellow with dampness and there is no bar or restaurant available till after 6pm. We had specifically asked for an early check in and although we were initially told upon arrival that the room would be ready for 11am- we were still waiting at 1.50pm. The hotel staff didnt communicate with us in English much, except for the Bellboy who seemed more than happy to help us. When we eventually got into our room we were totally disappointed as the room was tiny and we had to walk in single file sideways to get around as there was only room for the double bed. There was metal poles sticking out of the wall which may have been the result of air conditioning removal but the job has never been finished. The hot and cold tap has been installed back to front which took us a while to figure out and so we found ourselves washing in cold water then later brushing our teeth with scalding hot water! The room doors dont close properly which we only realised the next day-when we noticed the door had been open all night and upon leaving another resident was complaining that her belongings were missing after she went out and, like us, never noticed the door only sounds like its closing. There was a que of very unhappy customers when we checked out the next day, and we left wondering what a standard double room could possibly look like since ours was apparently delux. A very dissapointing hotel in an area where many other more appealing hotels are available for much more reasonable prices. Also would have been nice to find staff talking in English more as we felt very uncomfortable and misnderstood during our interactions with some of the receptionist staff.

Reviews.Title: “Go Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: alfie0312
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 20.00 after a long journey to be told that there wasn't a room for us. We would be moved to their sister hotel and upgraded - this was realy really inconvenient - we had arranged a meeting for dinner at somewhere nearby. We got to the other hotel as fast as possible checked in left our luggage and went out for dinner. We got to the room at about 23.00 and our hearts sank. This was an upgrade!!! How bad could the other room have been. It was tiny - no room to move, no room to put a case. Hot and stuffy, flies buzzing about (only two to be fair) dirty and scuffed. A shower too small to use. It was along miles of corridors on the second floor, didn't connect with the lift, felt like a fire hazard. No drinks in room. Bar when found was closed. Air conditioning worked eventually but sounded like a drowning whale. Trying not to be too negative - there was a nice tree outside the window. Go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in anywhere”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne097
Reviews.Content: I have traveled extensively both domestically and internationally. This is one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in. The first room I stayed in was in the basement and you could not walk around the bed it was so small. They then moved to a room on the first floor (actually second) which was even smalled probably about 6 X 9. I had to walk up and down stairs with my luggage. When I first got there, the hotel I booked into was full so they put me in a "sister" hotel across the street. The porter and I walked to the other hotel in the dark, dodging pot holes around a construction area. The only good thing was the free high speed internet which worked great. The staff was not very courteous or helpful either.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a London hotel in this area, good value at Â£120 for a single.”
Reviews.Author: Maclighter
Reviews.Content: First you have to understand that most hotels in this area are cramped. With that mind read on. There are many bad reviews on here, but this hotel must have read them and is upgrading it's decor. I stayed on 014 a basement single room. It was reasonably quite (no accounting for guests noisily chatting in the corridor before bed). The reception, clean, a little worn, but recently updated, efficient (when the manager arrived to help) and not a bad experience. The route to the room, is poor, lifts are slow and I found only one. Even then the corridors are not wide ( big cases beware) and there are many steps and fire doors. Sign posts, at least to my room were poor and the decor old and worn. The room, well it was a single and I have stayed in smaller, but consider it very compact. Short corridor, desk, huge TV above, small cupboard below, wardrobe, single bed (obviously new, comfortable, clean and well made but with sheet and blanket, no duvet). The bed side table showed it's age but was well placed as were the light switches (important on dark nights to be easy to find). The window was unsafe though, didn't really open well, whined if not closed properly and didn't lock, though it opened onto a courtyard which looked secure except to other guests. The bathroom, was compact too. If you're a large traveller then it's going to be a squeeze. Well furnished and obviously brand new, good decor, vey clean, almost a pleasure. But the shower was small, OK for me, but again larger travellers beware, you ain't gonna bend over. Lighting through out was good, well placed and enough for all needs. Luggage space, only the floor land precious little of that to go around, so large bags are going to get moved a lot! TV was free view and some Sky channels, great reception, and enough choice for me, no movie or pay selections, but I didn't really look too hard. WiFi was non existent, but there was free and very speedy cabled broadband, though no good for an iPad or other wireless device. I did here that ground floor refurbished rooms have Wifi so it may be available in some places or in the near future. Location is good, reasonably quiet, easy walk from Paddington Station. Overall I was happy and would stay in one of the returned rooms again. The hotel is still upgrading so you might want to ask in advance. Room service was non existent, the bar and breakfast I didn't try but they looked recently refurbed too.

Reviews.Title: “The staff wasn't so much malignant as clueless and uninterested.”
Reviews.Author: xparxy
Reviews.Content: We booked this room using laterooms.com. The site led us to believe that we were getting a room in a four-star hotel at the last minute for only $220/night. We wanted to be close to Paddington Station in order to make departure to Heathrow easier in the morning. The hotel is about a five minute walk from Paddington and is not difficult to find. We arrived two hours before the specified 14.00 check-in time and were permitted to store our bags with the hotel. We paid in full at the time of our initial arrival. We were a bit surprised to find that our bags (only two roll-ons) had not been shifted to our rooms when we returned four hours *after* the specified check-in, but so it goes. The room was small but clean. Good linens and comfortable bed. Nice bath. Quiet. No wifi in the rooms, alas. There was evidently ethernet connectivity but alas, that doesn't help much when one is traveling only with handheld devices. The hard-wired guest computer in the hotel lounge also failed to connect, but it took three different sets of guests observing this to the desk clerk before he verified that in fact all three sets were correct and then went off and presumably rebooted the hotel's router. This gave us a working machine in the lounge and also wifi there (but no where else in the hotel). Unfortunately, there was no email access: evidently whoever set up the hotel's router left common mail ports blocked. We could use our handhelds for web access to webmail but routine mail clients failed to work on multiple different platforms distributed amongst several unrelated guest parties. The sales-reps we shared the lounge with were not terribly pleased, nor were we. The clerk shrugged helplessly. You won't be able to print your boarding pass using the guest machine in the lounge: there's no printer. The clerk explained to us that this is circumvented by emailing said boarding passes to the hotel concierge who would then print them. He was, alas, unable to show us how to accomplish this using the guest computer, but explained "all of the other guests do it." In the end, even for location, not a $220/night hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was great and would love to come back.”
Reviews.Author: Sarah55502
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very nice and most of all the staff was extremely friendly especially the receptionist (harpreet who was so nice and helpful). Everything was up to my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “What a swizz!”
Reviews.Author: K8TNorthumberland
Reviews.Content: On arrival at this hotel we were upgraded from double to family rooms which I have no doubt was intended as a kind gesture but the result was we were both in cramped, over crowded accomodation. In one room you couldn't open the wardrobe door, in the other you couldn't walk round a bed but had to cllimb over it: a classic case of hotel managers trying to squeeze quarts - or even gallons - into pint pots! The hotel's facilities did not reflect the description of 4* laid out by Visit England or the AA and I have reported this to their inspectors. Tea and coffee making facilities were of poor quality. Room fridges/minibars and hospiitality had been removed. The hair drier was wired into a wall that did not have a mirror and the flex would not stretch to one. The ironing board was simply propped up loose against a wall will a burned and torn cover. There was no upholstered chair in the room and no side table. The hotel is clearly being refurbished and both rooms had very nice new shower room suites and had been recently redecorated. Nonetheless the rooms were so small it was difficult to sit on the lavatory, Bedroom furniture was old and shabby: scuffed, marked, handles loose and missing; and the bed sheets were worn and in one case torn. Throughout corridors coils of electrical cabling and piles of old newspapers were sitting on the floors for the duration of the weekend. On chekcing in and being asked to pay in full up front we were not informed that the air conditioning was broken. Later that evening we were told that it was in the process of being repaired - the repairs were not effective all weekend. Fans were not available and staff were not willing to sort any out for us. On three seperate occasions I asked for the duty manager to contact me. He/She failed to do so for the whole weekend. The breakfast room was clean and the cooked breakfast on offer was freshly cooked and plentiful if a little limited in options. The quality of the continental breakfast items was below par: tinned fruit, processed cheese and mechanically recovered meats. As in the bedrooms, tea and coffee were of a very poor quality. Candidly this hotel is not what is puports to be. It is not a patch on other 4* hotels in London. It's not anywhere cheap enough to make up for this. With the Lancaster at the end of the street less than 1/4 mile away offering vastly better accomodation and service plus fantastic views over Hyde Park for only Â£20 per night more, I see no reason to ever visit this hotel and certainly will not trouble to return to it. Not only will I not recommend it, I would warn friends against the Shafsbury Premier Hyde Park.

Reviews.Title: “Some of these reviews are unbeleivable but true.”
Reviews.Author: cranjee
Reviews.Content: I write this with the understanding this is London! I had an extended business stay. When I first arrived I was going to check out the next day thinking I couldn't stand it. but because of my work schedule I stayed. Up early home late. There is no doubt it is the smallest room I have stayed in, in my life. I have never had a berth on a ship smaller. I literally could not open my bag in the door way. I must of had a renovated room as the shower / toilet area was new. I am not a big person but if I dropped the soap I could not bend over to pick it up. But it was very clean. A big person could not have slept on the bed it was so small. I could literally feel the springs. Pretty aweful. The staff did their best to be pleasant but there seemed always to be a probelm at check in time. Reading the other reviews I can only guess people have issues checking in. I arrived early but a room was made available immediately. The worst issue I had is that without doubt my room had dust mites. I do not suffer from allergies but my God I would wake up with itchy eyes and would sneeze for five minutes when I finally got out of the room. This said the room was cleaned to the best of the staffs ability every day. I think the place is just so small beds cannot be moved to vaccum correctly. I definately will not stay there again mainly because of the dust mite issue. The staff were fine, the cleaners really did their best. The place is just to small and to cramped for space.

Reviews.Title: “"Overall service , excellent"”
Reviews.Author: CSROMANIA
Reviews.Content: This is costal sandu from Romania.The Service and facilities was undiscribably excellent.Atmosphere and Posture of the employees was A1 standard but I have appreciated the service given to me by lovely lady Harpret.I will recommend anyone to visit Shaftesbury premier Hyde park hotel.

Reviews.Title: “average 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: wexford007
Reviews.Content: stayed here for one night only with family taking in some shopping and sightseeing. hotel is in great location, rooms were good, great nights sleep. reception staff very poor, did not have the breakfast so cannot comment on food, the only thing going for this hotel is the location and the beds were very comfortable. Bathroom very small but did not find that a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: FrankW33
Reviews.Content: We never physically made it to the hotel. We booked this one and then got a call the night before we were due to go. Low and behold they had had a flood and we were to be moved to a sister hotel. Have a look at other reviews to see how often this occurs.When we checked online we found that the 'sister' one was a bed bug infested one. Naturallly we cancelled. Since then we have had our card cloned. Now we cannot prove this is linked however, this card was only used when booking this venue online and nowhere else so draw your own conclusions. My best advice would be to avoid like the plague!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the worst customer service ever!”
Reviews.Author: ScottishExposure
Reviews.Content: Possibly the worst customer service ever! I like many other guests faced the same story ( I believe because we booked through late rooms and were paying a cheaper price) on arrival. I was told that due to water problems!! In some of the rooms I had to move to another hotel near Earls Court. However well armed with my Trip Advisor knowledge I refused to budge from the reception desk until they found me a room. I had a meeting at 9am the next day hence why I asked for this hotel location and explained this to the receptionist. She made a big show of phoning 'central reservations' and after the 3rd attempt to send me a way in a taxi ( a queue of spectators was forming by this point!) suddenly a spare room appeared! The end of my woes... Definitely not! the receptionist was rude to me and the others at the desk , my room was the broom cupboard on the ground floor, it was noisy all night due to staff talking at reception, there were exposed electrical cables and the blankets on the bed were stained. I will be making official complaint to trading standards.

Reviews.Title: “Neat, cozy, great location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Demola2aa
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5nights @ d hotel. Good checking in/out processes. Warm welcome from staff in reception (Jamal on d 20th). Overall friendly staff, ready to assist throughout my stay. Neat rooms & toilet/bathroom facilities. Very good location, great & quiet environment with convenient (8min) walking distance to paddington or Lancaster gate train stations. Bus stop in front of d hotel gave good access to Central London & many other places for Shopping & sightseeing. Hyde park at d back was also fun. However, I didn't like the idea that A/C in my room didnt work most of my stay. Was later provided with a table fan to deal with ventilation & coolness required in my room on d ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “it's a pity I can't give zero ratings - p**s poor”
Reviews.Author: Leedslad79
Reviews.Content: it started badly and got worse like many others we arrived to be told that the room we booked was unavailable and that we could transfer. when I said the hotel is not convenient I was told find another one - in central London at short notice!! I was then informed I should have called hotel to confirm booking which I did was then told sorry we had a trainee working needless to say other than providing a complentary cab to their hotel the service was terrible

Reviews.Title: “Construction Site”
Reviews.Author: tarabyrne2
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel last minute but regardless the booking agent should have mentioned that 4 floors were under massive construction. We were awaken every morning (wed-sat) by hammering. sawing and what ever else you hear on a construction site. I was on the 7th floor and the elevator doesnt even run up there so we had to carrying our luggage up a winding staircase and through a slender hall. It wouldnt have been too bad but it was also extremely warm on the 7th floor. The AC unit was not working in our room so our only choice to open the windows and let more sound in. There was an issue with the new door system so we had to re set our keys every afternoon. We did have a leaky shower but after one complaint a maintenance man came up and fixed it immediately. The staff was pleasant and nice but i am sure they were bombarded. The rooms were very clean, small but big TV and nice furniture. The location is great. Just far enough from paddington to avoid the noise but a nice walk in a beautiful area. I might give them a 2nd chance once the construction is done but i need a while to get over that.

Reviews.Title: “Awful ... Easily the worst hotel I've stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: k_in_london186338
Reviews.Content: I just checked in to the hotel. When I arrived, I had to look closely as it did look like it's being renovated and not open for business. The check-in was fairly easy, but a couple of people were complaining, nothing serious though. I was told my room is in the basement, and that's when I realized that things can't be that good. I got into the lift and pressed the B button which had a paper covering it (freshly torn) informing guests that they shouldn't head to the basement. I did. I was met by painters and the smell of fresh paint, TVs, Safes, etc. strewn all over the basement. I struggled with my suitcase and managed to find my room through the wonderful fumes, only to find what can only be described as the smallest room in London. I've stayed in hotels that aren't allegedly "four stars" and that cost far less than this. I've stayed at bed and breakfasts and hotels that have had lower ratings on Trip Advisor, but this is a joke. I called reception to ask if I could be moved, I heard the receptionists talking and one asked the other which company I was with, she said none, and so I was told that the hotel is "full" and that they might be able to move me tomorrow. Furthermore, while the website states that there is a safe in the room, there isn't. My advice, steer clear, and stay at one of the many B&Bs in this area or in Kensington. They will be cheaper and better (they can't possibly be worse).

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost”
Reviews.Author: amsull
Reviews.Content: Booked a twin room as attending a function with a colleague from work, on arrival place was like a building site, scaffolding and numerous builders, we were given a tiny double room with a double bed, it definitely was not a room with a view as we looked over other rooms and scaffolding. we asked if we could change to a room with twin beds as booked , and were told no other rooms available, we asked if we could upgrade and have a single room each, again no rooms, staff were so unhelpful. We contacted a colleague who had booked for us and then surprise surprise we were offered a three person room with single beds, this was after we had been told no rooms available, so the staff were obviously not telling the truth!!!!!!, rooms are extremely small and bathrooms even smaller, I couldn't wait to leave I would advise anyone who has booked a room here to change asap

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Helpful”
Reviews.Author: SueLindsey1
Reviews.Content: I had concerns about the booking my daughter had made with this chain of hotels, as I had read various reviews on Trip Advisor stating staff were extremely unhelpful. We were due to stay for 1 night, as we were going to various shows over the weekend. We arrived at the hotel, which looked like a building site with scaffolding everywhere, (I could see the annoyance on my daughter's face) as we had not been informed of this. We had a deluxe twin room booked on the 1st floor. My daughter had previously telephoned, as I can't manage stairs very well. The lift does not stop at the 1st floor for some reason and my daughter had not been informed of this! Contrary to what I had read I found the staff extremely helpful, one receptionist in particular. The extremely helpful receptionist, Romana, provided us with complimentary drinks, whilst she tried to find us alternative accommodation, where I would not need to attempt stairs. The person she spoke with on the phone, found us a place at the Shaftesbury Premier Notting Hill. We did not want to be that far away from the shows etc. Yet again Romana got back on the telephone to their bookings facility. We even heard her saying "yes, I appreciate you are trying your best, but you must try harder". What a star you were Romana, not only did you at this point, provide us with complimentary sandwiches, but you had us upgraded to a club room with the Shaftesbury Hotel just across the road, where we had a pleasant stay. I'm disappointed that we had the hassle in the first place, but I am so grateful for the assistance that you gave us.

Reviews.Title: “small but clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: serenawaldorf88
Reviews.Content: the hotel is a 5 mins walk from paddington station and close to pubs and some restaurants. the room was small but is fine for people who just need a place to stay ad spend most of the day out. the toilet is extremely close to the bath so if you're a large size person i wouldn't recommend this hotel! would prob stay here again as it only cost 55 a night

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and value for money”
Reviews.Author: jameson_jean
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel staff friendly and helpful. The Deputy Manager Kumar is very warm towards guests. Free internet access is a big plus point for business guests. It is a small, clean and comfortable hotel, excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MidgetGem1980
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on lastminute.com as a "mystery hotel", but specifically because we wanted to be in that area of London. Arrived to be told there was a maintenance fault and they would taxi us across to another hotel in their chain "just the other side of Hyde Park" but no specific information as to what hotel and where. Having looked at trip advisor subsequently, it seems clear that this hotel is blatantly overbooking its rooms and then sending you to another hotel. Now I can't say what the Hyde Park Premier is like inside as I never made it into a room, but the Kensington Townhouse where we were sent was absolutely horrendous. I would not book with this chain again, and would urge you not to also.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a central location”
Reviews.Author: tigger47london
Reviews.Content: It is difficult to find a better hotel of this standard in London at this price (Â£66 per night inc full Breakfast) . THe starf were helpfull & curtious , (special thank you to Kiran on the front desk for her help) . Just a few hundred m from Paddington & lancaster gate tubes the location is excellent and is also in a quiet area . Free Wifi in the room was a bonus. Breakfast was superb, a great choice , & complimentary newspapers. Graham Sussex.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Service at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SHAMBOLICBarnsley
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel just off the web site,on reviews it stated small rooms,so I was a bit worried. I was taking my brother and wife as a suprise as he has had a Bone Marrow transplant and asked if they could do anything special for them in the room. They supplied flowers and a bottle of wine free of charge.The room was good.clean,well kept and good value for the price.Going back next week.would recommend this to anyone

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING. A TOTAL CON. PLEASE DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!”
Reviews.Author: SwissUK
Reviews.Content: Oh how I wish i'd read the reviews on TA before I booked into this place. We arrived at reception to be greeted by the friendly man who took my money on debit card and then told me that due to a building maintence fault (yes that BS line again!) we were being transfered to there sister hotel 5 minutes away. Arrived there and was told that I was actually being put in the special clubrooms around the corner. Arrived to find another hotel complex containing shabby rooms with broken windows! They then put me back into the sister hotel in the basement with room with broken matresses and a bust TV. I complained again and was moved yet again into a shoe box of a room over the road!!!!!!!! This story goes on and on and on until I BLEW my top with the manager and demanded a refund - which they refused to give so I stood in reception shouting and making a massive scene in front of all the hotel guests until I got a full refund and a taxi to the station. THEY ARE CONNING PEOPLE - PLEASE DO NOT MAKE THE MISTAKE I MADE.

Reviews.Title: “Truly my worst hotel experience in a long time.”
Reviews.Author: Thirtyyearjourno
Reviews.Content: As I write it is 3.45 in the morning. I should be asleep. I want to sleep. I need to sleep. I arrived here after a long flight and a tiring business trip. I chose this hotel because it is close to Paddington station and I need to catch a train home in the morning. I found it on Booking.com where it is rated as a four star hotel. They are having a laugh. In summary, the room is small, hot, uncomfortable overlooking a busy road and to cap it all the walls are paper thin. So I can hear every word of the party and chat in the room next door. I am now resigned to get no sleep whatsoever. The foreign staff on the reception desk are trying to be helpful but their english language ability is worse than the staff at the hotel I was staying in abroad. My strong recommendation is Do Not Stay Here. I can't wait to get out.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Awful Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: mike137
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel via late rooms and it seemed a bargain... close to Paddington and a 4 star (this I somewhat doubt). Pros Good location Good Price Cons Monumentally Small Bathroom Non Functional Air Con Unable to open windows (Pigeons nesting on window sill) Very Poor Customer Service Certainly not a 4 star hotel - more like 2.. Over priced breakfast Serious lack of plug sockets - only 1 in the room (All equipment in room powered from spurs) Very poor lighting Would we stay here again - NO. Would I stay we with chain again -NO. Avoid Avoid Avoid

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you want a good night's sleep!”
Reviews.Author: lunt82
Reviews.Content: The location was great, and the reception staff were pleasant enough.
